# unicorn/require-array-join-separator <Badge type="info" text="Style" />

<div class="rule-meta">
<Alert class="fix" type="info">
<span class="emoji">üõ†Ô∏è</span> An auto-fix is available for this rule for some violations.
</Alert>
</div>

### What it does

Enforce using the separator argument with Array#join()

### Why is this bad?

It's better to make it clear what the separator is when calling Array#join(),
instead of relying on the default comma (',') separator.

### Example

```javascript
// Bad
foo.join();

// Good
foo.join(",");
```

- [Rule Source](https://github.com/oxc-project/oxc/blob/main/crates/oxc_linter/src/rules/unicorn/require_array_join_separator.rs)
